name: Overview
main:
Libya is divided between three governments, each relying on local militias for territorial control. The country has been in a state of civil war since 2014, generating shortages of food, fuel, water, medical supplies and electricity, as well as reduced access to healthcare and public services. 

Health, protection, shelter and NFIs are main reported needs, for both displaced and host population. 

INFORM measures Libya's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be high, at 6.0/10. Hazard and exposure as well as lack of coping capacity are of particular concern, at 8.4/10 and 6.7/10 respectively.?
latest_developments_past:
16/05: Escalation of fighting in Derna on 15 May affected at least 100,000 people. Over 1,500 people displaced within the city. Protection concerns and humanitarian needs are high amid movement restrictions and impediments to entry.?

14/05: Renewed fighting in Sebha since 11 May displaced additional 700 people within the area. Insecurity and movement restrictions have considerably limited access to food, water, fuel, and basic commodities.  The town is facing shortages in medical supplies and personnel, limiting access to healthcare. Education is also a need.?
